newsitem.title: USA: Richard Koe buys over 5 percent of Blyth.
newsitem.headline: Richard Koe buys over 5 percent of Blyth.

text.p: Blyth Holdings Inc said Tuesday that Richard Koe, president of Astoria Capital, had purchased 935,000 Blyth shares, or more than a five percent stake.
It said Koe bought the stock for investment purposes and has no plans to acquire the company.

"We see Richard's investment as an indicator that we're executing a sound business strategy for the rapid delivery of mission-critical client/server and Web applications," said Blyth President and Chief Executive Officer Tim Negris. "Because of my own belief in the company, I have recently personally acquired over 50,000 shares."
